alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 12:17PM AKST until March 01 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY STARTING TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... A rapidly strengthening low will develop in the Gulf of Alaska during the day on Tuesday. This low is expected to move towards the northern gulf coast before stalling out during the day on Wednesday. Snow will begin in the Yakutat area before extending to the south during the overnight hours of Tuesday night into the day on Wednesday. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals for the southern half of the panhandle as southerly flow may cause a mix with or complete change to rain Wednesday afternoon and evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Central inner channels. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall expected late Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. Snow could mix with rain Wednesday afternoon and evening.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Petersburg Borough; Western Kupreanof and Kuiu Island
